intro: Rhabdocaulon grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered rhabdocaulon, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It has opposite, simple leaves that are often elliptical or ovate in shape. Rhabdocaulon grandiflorum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
